itemDescription: English settler in Australia and mineowner

wikipedia_page.main: John Benjamin Graham (8 March 1813 – 8 November 1876) was an English settler in the early days of South Australia, who became very wealthy thanks to his mining interests, then left the colony, but not before establishing a mansion for many years known as "Graham's Castle".

response: * John Benjamin Graham (1814–1876), English settler and investor in South Australia who built "Graham's Castle"
His father was John Benjamin Graham.  He studied at the University of Oxford.  He never married.
